item.title: Maximal $d$-spectra via Priestley duality
item.description: arXiv:2501.07673v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: We use Priestley duality as a new tool to study maximal $d$-spectra of arithmetic frames, both with and without units. We pay special attention to when the maximal $d$-spectrum is compact or Hausdorff. Various necessary and sufficient conditions are given, including a construction of an arithmetic frame with a unit whose maximal $d$-spectrum is not Hausdorff, thus resolving an open problem in the literature.
item.arxiv:journal_reference: Journal of Algebra and Its Applications (2025)
item.dc:creator: G. Bezhanishvili, P. Bhattacharjee, S. D. Melzer
